intro: Pipturus albidus var. tahitensis, commonly known as Tahitian white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has heart-shaped, glossy leaves and thrives in moist, tropical environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
